
### C and cache misses (assoc)  {.smaller}


```c
int array[1024]; /* assume aligned */
int even_sum = 0, odd_sum = 0;
even_sum += array[0];
even_sum += array[2];
even_sum += array[512];
even_sum += array[514];
odd_sum += array[1];
odd_sum += array[3];
odd_sum += array[511];
odd_sum += array[513];

```
[ Assume everything but `array` is kept in registers (and the compiler does not do anything funny).
<br>observation: `array[0]`, `array[256]`, `array[512]`, `array[768]` in same set]{.my-small} 

* How many data cache misses on a 2KB 2-way set associative cache with 16B blocks?
